result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elliot D. LeBrun

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: granting request to travel abroad w/ conditions

Defendant Elliot D. LeBrun in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF174, 14CF451

8:41 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files Amended Information.   
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  Requests expungment under 973.015. 

Court questions Atty Hughes regarding his request for a PSI. 
Court and both parties have received letters from the defendants family. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2 - NO CONTEST
Count 5 - NO CONTEST
Count 6 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 2, 5 and 6.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Counts 1, 3 & 4 and 14CF451 are dismissed and read-in. 

BY THE COURT: Court will not proceed with a PSI. 
Atty Hughes requests a later sentencing date to allow for the defendant's family to be present. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.
Status conference on January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elliot D. LeBrun in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Elliot D. LeBrun in court with attorney Michael Hughes (special appearance today). David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

$500 cash bond.  Can sign wage assignment at $50 per week to be released.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. Comply with conditions as listed in 14CF174.

DA #14PT2163
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Hughes is present.
ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500.00 cash bond:   with conditions as stated.
Atty Hughes requests sig bond.

BTC: $500 cash bond.  Can sign wage assignment at $50 per week to be released.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. Comply with conditions as listed in 14CF174. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  12-01-2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
